isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - HARD START AND NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Glow Plug System

svcproc.title: Glow Plug System
svcproc.para: To determine if the glow plug system is operating correctly to start the engine

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

figure.caption: Current Clamp around feed wire loom for right side glow plugs

step1.para: Install a Current Clamp around the feed wire loom for glow plugs in the right side.
Turn ignition key ON. (Do not start the engine.)
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: Test 8 (Key On Engine Off Standard Test) must have been done before doing the Glow Plug Output State Test.

step1.para: From Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug Output State Test and click run to start the test.
After 40 seconds, record the amperage reading for the right side on Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics form.

figure.caption: Current Clamp around feed wire loom for left side glow plugs

step1.para: Install Current Clamp around the feed wire loom for glow plugs in the left side.

item.para: If not done within 120 seconds of starting Glow Plug Output State Test, repeat step 5 for left side glow plugs.
If a reading is below or above the amperage specification, do Test 15B (Glow Plug System Components).
If reading is 0 amps, do Test 8 (Key On Engine Off Standard Test). For DTC 251 see Glow Plug Control Circuits in Section 7.
